intro: Melandrium melananthum, commonly known as the black-flowered catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its distinctive dark purple to black flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. Its stems are erect and branching, with opposite, oval-shaped leaves. The flowers are short-lived and are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds.
